TopicTitle: [1.7.3] SPC-v0.19 | Spaceplane Corrections, stock part texture improvements and trim switching (8 September 17)

Articles.Content:
***SPC*** *- Spaceplane Corrections*

Hello everyone!

Personally I've been pretty annoyed that a number of stock parts don't have matching colors or shades. There are two generic white coats used for splaceplane or rocket parts, and there are at least *five* different shades of gray used for trim (Mk1, Mk2, Mk3, Spaceplane, Airliner, etc...). This really bugs me when building intricate craft so I decided to fix this with FireSpitters texture switch plugin (FSTextureSwitch2) to add a widget to swap between textures and trim colors, as well as fix a number couple of misaligned textures and add a few aesthetic changes along the way. I hope they suit your fancy ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

This mod is dependent on the [Firespitter](http://snjo.github.io/) *plugin* maintained by [@RoverDude](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105198-roverdude/) and [ModuleManager](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219-1-0-x-Module-Manager-2-6-3-%28May-4%29-Bonsai-Trimming-Kit-Edition) maintained by [@sarbian](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57146-sarbian/). Thank you all so much for making this mod work.

**Make sure to download and install the latest ModuleManager.dll! Firespitter is bundled with the download.**

**Example image:**

![AloZRTz.png](https://i.imgur.com/AloZRTz.png)

Trim change gif example: [https://i.imgur.com/GrJgIwL.gifv](https://i.imgur.com/GrJgIwL.gifv)

Flap retexture gif example: [https://i.imgur.com/5ebwtVz.gifv](https://i.imgur.com/5ebwtVz.gifv)

More images: [http://imgur.com/a/KjyV5](http://imgur.com/a/KjyV5)

-Embed links seem to be broken ![:/](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/ZNGIcon1.png ":/")There's a lot more that isn't mentioned or shown in those images (I.E. retextured the blue nosecone and small decoupler, etc). Check the SpaceDock version history for a much more complete list.

**Download:**

[SPC v0.19 (Spacedock)](https://spacedock.info/mod/1194/SpacePlane%20Corrections)

**License:**

This mod is published under the MIT lisense. [**View it here**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kr-4bJ1yCtrmjP-lTG0WdmCc0E-bmNy7ZFOozskunhs).

Well, that's all for now folks! Thanks for the read, and I'll see you all later.

- Avera9eJoe

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-01T18:25:52Z" title="05/01/2015 06:25  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 1, 2015</time> by Avera9eJoe**

1.02 seems to have broken at least the Advanced Canard. Probably some other stuff too, but I haven't come across them. These fixes make everything better, so I thought you should know.

EDIT: Also, is there a way you could make the textures a little less defined (or something to that effect)? The textures seem to have some weird artifacts or... I don't really know how to describe it but look at the SPCC Big S delta wing. There's something off in it. Anti-aliasing seems confused.

Yeah one second... I'm noticing the canard missing too. I'll take another sweep at the Big S delta. I purposely added contrast to bring out the paneling and scorching on the top, but I can easily dim it a bit. Did you download v0.05?

> 
> Yeah one second... I'm noticing the canard missing too. I'll take another sweep at the Big S delta. I purposely added contrast to bring out the paneling and scorching on the top, but I can easily dim it a bit. Did you download v0.05?

Oh, there's a v.0.05? I think that happened after I posted the comment. Downloading now...

EDIT: Yeah, it seems to have something to do with there being an AirplaneFins texture file, but then, I'm not sure what goes where. I'm no good with these things.

Ryan I just updated the "cover" GIF and download. Does this fix it?

> 
> Ryan I just updated the "cover" GIF and download. Does this fix it?

I'll check- Tomorrow! I'm kind of tired.
Very interesting! I think I am going to install this when I get the opportunity!

Nice mod!

Also, all the Rockomax tanks are *very* out of place.
Cool idea. Just wondering if it would be better to use Texture Replacer or Module Manager to replace the textures rather than overwriting them.

> 
> Cool idea. Just wondering if it would be better to use Texture Replacer or Module Manager to replace the textures rather than overwriting them.

I'm actually seriously debating that. The only reason I'm replacing them I because it would save memory to just replace the stock textures. If that isn't a high priority worry, I may end up using texture replacer - though I am also a fan of having an independent mod too.
Cool mod a standardised texture for all the fuel tanks would be nice they are all over the place. I hate the textures for the medium 1.25 tank and the smaller 2.5 tanks they just don't fit right.

> 
> I'm actually seriously debating that. The only reason I'm replacing them I because it would save memory to just replace the stock textures. If that isn't a high priority worry, I may end up using texture replacer - though I am also a fan of having an independent mod too.

Module manager fixes wouldn't be too bad, but I have a few mods that don't play with texture replacer, so if you go down the texture replacer route, and it isn't too hard to keep a copy and replace version around, I'd be super happy about it.
Okay, yup, they do work. The advanced canards, that is.
Alright I've put up a secondary TextureReplacer download. Time to enjoy 1.0.2 for a bit ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

Double post sorry

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-02T22:14:25Z" title="05/02/2015 10:14  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 2, 2015</time> by InsanePlumber**

KSP 1.0+ now natively supports the DDS format for textures.

SPPCC v0.6.0 does not use the minimap in DDS files, and it should be due to the optimization. (unless KSP does not use the mini map in DDS, just starting my adventure with modding KSP)

> 
> KSP 1.0+ now natively supports the DDS format for textures.
> SPPCC v0.6.0 does not use the minimap in DDS files, and it should be due to the optimization. (unless KSP does not use the mini map in DDS, just starting my adventure with modding KSP)

All of my images are in .dds format. So... what are you saying?

[**MiniMap for textures on Wiki.**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mipmap)

EDIT

What program do you use to create textures. I'll help you optimize them. (give you a hint what options to use when writing to the DDS format.)

EDIT2

[Link to optimized textures on GoogleDrive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6ioBcQsnDXDcl8xbGdzb2dTZEU/view?usp=sharing).

The original non-optimized without minimap

11,0 MB (11.535.815 bytes)

Optimized with minimaps

8,66 MB (9.088.680 bytes) ~20% less memory consumption
